text: John Wilson (1889 – 20 September 1914) was a Scottish professional football half back who played in the Scottish League for Vale of Leven and Dumbarton. == Personal life == Wilson was married. After the outbreak of the First World War in August 1914, he enlisted as a private in The Black Watch (Royal Highlanders) in Auchterarder. Wilson died of wounds at the Hotel Majestic Military Hospital in Paris on 20 September 1914 and was buried in the Cimetière parisien de Bagneux. == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |Scottish Cup ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |Dumbarton |1912–13 |Scottish Second Division |11 |3 |0 |0 |11 |3 |- |Vale of Leven |1913–14 |Scottish Second Division |13 |1 |3 |0 |16 |1 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !24 !4 !3 !0 !27 !4 |} == References == Category:1889 births Category:1914 deaths Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football wing halves Category:Dumbarton F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:British military personnel killed in World War I Category:Vale of Leven F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Perth and Kinross Category:Black Watch soldiers Category:Burials at the Cimetière de Bagneux
title: John Wilson (footballer, born 1889)
